info.description: Common Resources is the largest single domain and consists of two groupings. Common Resources are shared by all domains, allowing you to access and manipulate general employee data, user display profiles, business structures, the Control Center, the Transaction Assistant, and data aggregated across domains.
info.title: Common Resources II

tags.description:
From here you may browse our library of API resources, organized hierarchically by domain, or major functional area, logical subgroup, API resource, and all available operations against that resource. For more information about the concepts and technology behind our API, refer to the [Foundations](doc:foundations-doc) documentation.

Our platform provides a powerful application programming interface and documentation to help you develop secure, scalable, and high-performance applications that leverage the full breadth of capabilities offered by our backend services.

The API is founded on a pragmatic implementation of the [representational state transfer](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_State_Transfer) architectural style and allows access to your organization's workforce management data using common HTTP methods and the [JSON](http://www.json.org) interchange format.
tags.name: API

tags.description: This resource represents collectively retrievable data from multiple sources: Timekeeping, Scheduling, Commons, and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). Operations on this resource use a powerful SQL-like syntax to query data. These queries include complex filtering and reduction functions as well as grouping, sorting, and pagination options.
tags.name: Aggregated Data

tags.description:
Business structures, also known as organizational maps, enable you to define a hierarchical structure for your organization using types, locations, and jobs.

A business structure defines trees containing nodes that represent these three components. Types represent logical organizational levels in your enterprise. Locations represent a physical location or a logistical unit that is not a physical location. Jobs represent roles with fixed responsibilities.

Refer to the [Business Structure overview](doc:business-structure-overview-doc) topic in [Domain overviews](doc:domain-overviews-doc) for more information.
tags.name: Business Structures

tags.description: Common Resources is the largest single domain and consists of two groupings. Common Resources are shared by all domains, allowing you to access and manipulate general employee data, user display profiles, business structures, the Control Center, the Transaction Assistant, and data aggregated across domains.
tags.name: Common Resources II

tags.description: Currency contains resources to configure Currency Policies and retrieve conversion rates or conversion amounts between two different currencies.
tags.name: Currency

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve a currency definition by ID or retrieve all currency definitions.
tags.name: Currency Definitions

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, and update currency policies. Currency policies are a regional setting that can be assigned as the tenant default or to individual users. The usersâ€™ settings take precedence over the default setting for the tenant default settings.
tags.name: Currency Policies

tags.description:
This resource allows you to create, update, activate, and deactivate Data Elements within the Data Dictionary.

The Data Dictionary is a collection of Data Elements from all domains in the suite. A particular set of Data Elements, known as Gold Data Elements, are automatically loaded by the system and can be immediately used to create Dataviews.
tags.name: Data Dictionary

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, read, delete, and manipulate profiles that control which Dataviews users are allowed to view and the ways in which Dataviews are used.
tags.name: Dataview Profiles

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, read, delete, and manipulate custom data sources that are modeled after the common database concept of views. You can create a Dataview to pull together virtually any kind of data into a single view by selecting data elements from the Data Dictionary and applying a filter to one or more of those elements. Dataviews are often used to retrieve the same kinds of data multiple times, such as reusing a query, rather than for ad hoc data retrieval. A particular set of Dataviews, known as Gold Dataviews, are automatically loaded by the system. Dataview operations use the user profile, and a particular user gains access to a Dataview by means of a DataviewProfile, which has one or more associated Dataviews.
tags.name: Dataviews

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve conversion rates and exchange amounts between different currency policies for a defined time period.
tags.name: Exchange Rates

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate Known Places, which are defined as a GPS position with a radius and accuracy and/or a collection of WiFi Networks. Known Places can be associated with a location. Known Places can be used for a variety of location-based features, such as geofencing.
tags.name: GPS Known Places

tags.description:
This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate generic locations. Generic Locations can be a physical location (Operating Room or Mail Room) or a logistical unit that is not a physical location (Support, Administration, a Home Care Unit).

This resource is only available when the Simplified Business Structure feature is enabled.
tags.name: Generic Locations

tags.description: The Home Pages resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete home pages, which are the first page users see when they log in to the application's user interface. This resource also provides mechanisms for personalizing home pages and restoring home pages to default settings.
tags.name: Home Pages

tags.description: The Hyperfind domain provides search-like functionality that allows you to filter and select groups of employees through queries that specify conditions or locations.
tags.name: Hyperfind

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve information about Hyperfind Profiles. Hyperfind Profiles contain a specified group of public Hyperfind queries. Managers to whom a profile is assigned can access those queries.
tags.name: Hyperfind Profiles

tags.description:
This resource allows you to retrieve and execute Hyperfind queries.

Hyperfind is a search function that you can use for standard and custom queries to find employees who match specified search criteria.

The system uses employee IDs to display data, generate a report, or generate schedules for the group of employees selected. Dataviews use Hyperfind queries to display summaries of employee activity or details within a specified time period.

Hyperfind returns only the employee IDs allowed by a user's Function Access Profile; that is, a query only returns those people in the user's employee group and/or organizational sets to whom the user has access.
tags.name: Hyperfind Queries

tags.description:
The Information Access domain provides programmatic access to data from various sources in a manner similar to the way a database is accessed. The resources within this domain allow ad hoc queries, dynamic definition and execution of Data Views, and access to the Data Dictionary.

Refer to the [Information Access overview](doc:information-access-overview-doc) topic in [Domain overviews](doc:domain-overviews-doc) for more information.
tags.name: Information Access

tags.description:
This resource provides a set of operations that allow you to create, read, update, and delete jobs.

Jobs are roles that have a fixed responsibility (Registered Nurse, Associate, Welder). Jobs are attached to locations on the business structure that represent locations where employees actually perform those jobs.
tags.name: Jobs

tags.description: Known Places are used for GEO Sensing. GEO Sensing allows managers who are responsible for multiple departments or geographic areas to set the context for their workforce data to any specific location. A Known Place is defined as a GPS position with a radius. In setup, administrators can define one or many Known Places. When employees log in, the system uses the employees' GPS positions to determine if they are in a Known Place.
tags.name: Known Places

tags.description:
This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete labor categories.

Labor categories can be used to collect additional data that is not part of the hierarchical structure of the organization (the business structure). Typically, this is what the employee can work on. For example, a labor category could be a project, contract, or shift.

Labor categories are optional. A maximum of 6 labor categories can be configured on a system. No relationship exists, hierarchical or otherwise, between labor categories. Labor categories are treated as independent data fields. You can assign labor categories to locations on the business structure.
tags.name: Labor Categories

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, or delete labor category entries. Labor category entries are assigned to a labor category.
tags.name: Labor Category Entries

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete labor category list assignments. Labor category list assignments are the association between an organization node (in the business structure), a labor category, and a labor category list assignment.
tags.name: Labor Category List Assignments

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete labor category lists. Labor category lists contain labor category entries.
tags.name: Labor Category Lists

tags.description: The Labor Category Profiles resource allows you to add, delete, or change labor category profile objects within the system.
tags.name: Labor Category Profiles

tags.description: Labor categories capture data that is not part of the hierarchical structure, like Crew, Event, or Shift; typically representing what is worked on. Labor categories may be contrasted to business structures, which represent where employees perform work.
tags.name: Labor Category Setup

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve labor entry lists, which define the labor category entries to which an employee can transfer.
tags.name: Labor Entry Lists

tags.description: The Licensing domain allows you to provide license- and package-related information.
tags.name: Licensing

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete locale policies. Local policies contain regional settings (language locale, date format, number format, and currency format) that can be assigned as the tenant default or to individual users. The users' settings take precedence over the default setting for the tenant. Users see the user interface in the language and regional settings assigned to them in their locale policy. The locale policy is assigned to users in People Information.
tags.name: Locale Policies

tags.description: The Locale Settings domain contains regional settings (language locale, date format, number format, and currency format) that can be assigned as the tenant default or to individual users. The users' settings take precedence over the default setting for the tenant. Users see the user interface in the language and regional settings assigned to them in their locale policy. The locale policy is assigned to users in People Information.
tags.name: Locale Settings

tags.description:
This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate location attribute assignments.

Location attribute assignments display the direct assignments for a set of assigned locations and an effective date. Starting from the effective date, such locations will have a directly assigned location attribute and will not inherit it from parent locations.
tags.name: Location Attribute Assignments

tags.description:
This resource allows you to retrieve location attribute values, such as the start day of the week for a specified location and effective date.

The start day of the week can be directly assigned to a specified location or can be inherited from the parent location. The start day of the week allows you retrieve forecasts, manipulate the business structure, and correctly use other forecasting functionality.
tags.name: Location Attribute Start Day Of Week

tags.description:
This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate business structure location attributes.

Location attributes can be used to collect additional data about an organization on the business structure. For example, a location attribute can define a starting day of the week for a location. By default, location attributes are inherited from parent locations and can be overridden by assigning another location attribute. You can assign location attributes to locations on the business structure.
tags.name: Location Attributes

tags.description:
This resource provides a set of operations that allow you to retrieve and manipulate location sets.

Locations, which each represent a physical location (Operating Room or Mail Room) or a logistical unit that is not a physical location (Support, Administration, a Home Care Unit), can be grouped into sets.
tags.name: Location Sets

tags.description:
This resource provides a set of operations that allow you to create, read, update, and delete location types.

Location types are logical organizational levels in your enterprise, such as region, division, store, area, and department.
tags.name: Location Types

tags.description: Locations can be a physical location (Operating Room or Mail Room) or a logistical unit that is not a physical location (Support, Administration, a Home Care Unit). You can use the operations associated with this resource to create, update, delete, and view locations.
tags.name: Locations

tags.description:
The Tiles resource allows you to retrieve all administrator- and user-created tiles and cards.

Tiles provide access to important content about your employees and organization. They can appear on your home page as a visual representation of a common task that you frequently perform, such as a current schedule or a timesheet. They can also appear as a visualization of a metric, or other summarization, in the form of a pie chart or graph. You can show or hide tiles depending on what aspect of your business you want to view.
tags.name: Tiles

tags.description: This resource allows you to resolve start and end dates of a specified time increment. Time increment values can be DAY, WEEK, MONTH and QUARTER.
tags.name: Time Increment Resolver

tags.description: This resource allows you to access locale policy user preferences.
tags.name: User Preferences

  • [WCO-106017] - Unable to resolve Employee-Qualifier for the specified request parameters: {qualifier}.
  • [WCO-106019] - Invalid symbolic period: specified id and/or qualifier cannot be resolved.
  • [WCO-106028] - Employees are excluded from the data below based on your assigned Employee Group. You are seeing only those employees you are permitted to view.
  • [WCO-106029] - Invalid time increment. Valid {timeIncrement} values - DAY, WEEK, MONTH, QUARTER.
  • [WCO-106032] - Unable to resolve Location-Qualifier for the specified request parameters: {qualifier}.
  • [WCO-106151] - Data request FROM parameter required

  • [WCO-106154] - View parameter is required
  • [WCO-106161] - Invalid Timeframe-ID
  • [WCO-106162] - Unable to resolve Business Structure-ID for the specified request parameters: {id}
  • [WCO-106163] - Unable to retrieve specified employee {empid} for the selected timeframe. Possible causes: employee is inactive or the incorrect employee-ID is specified.
  • [WCO-106176] - Index must be less than or equal to {maxIndex}
  • [WCO-106178] - Invalid Id or Hyperfind ID or Saved Location ID
  • [WCO-106179] - Invalid property for column: {key}.
  • [WCO-106180] - You do not have permission to view this node (id: {id} and path: {qualifier}) in the specified timeframe.
  • [WCO-106185] - Configuration issues (invalid hierarchy, incorrect timeframe, or authorization) are preventing access to this Dataview. Contact your administrator to modify the Dataview configuration.
  • [WCO-106199] - Invalid Internal Application Key Provided.
  • [WCO-106204] - Invalid Hyperfind.
  • [WCO-112001] - Hyperfind queryText, QueryId, persons and locations list cannot be empty. Please select any one to execute the hyperfind.
  • [WCO-112003] - {Message}
  • [WCO-112004] - An unknown error occurred. {Message}
  • [WCO-112005] - Either a symbolic period or date range is required.
  • [WCO-112006] - More than two option selected for executing hyperfind.
  • [WCO-112009] - Either the query does not exist or you dont have permission to execute the provided hyperfind.
  • [WCO-112011] - Number of employees passed in request is above the threshold limit of {threshold}.
  • [WCO-112012] - Number of locations passed in request is above the threshold limit of {threshold}
  • [WCO-112017] - Invalid location id(s) for given date range or location id(s) does not exist
  • [WCO-116010] - The parameter {paramName} is invalid.
  • [WCO-116012] - The person number is mandatory and should not be empty.
  • [WCO-116013] - The employee number is mandatory and should not be empty.
  • [WCO-116016] - Unable to calculate the date span for {symbId} for the current user.
  • [WCO-116022] - The period type is mandatory and should not be empty.
  • [WFM-COMMON-1234] - Failed to retrieve some data from the providers
  • [WCO-106214] - WorkunitSet attribute is required for this request.
  • [WCO-106215] - Some rollups have invalid parameter values. Valid {rollUp} values: EMPLOYEE, WORKGROUP, JOB, VOLUME_LABEL, VOLUME_LABEL_BY_POST_DATE.
  • [WCO-106216] - The parameter is not allowed: {timeIncrement}
  • [WCO-106217] - Invalid time increment. Valid {timeIncrement} values - DAY, WEEK, MONTH, QUARTER, PAYPERIOD.
  • [WCO-106218] - VOLUME_LABEL or VOLUME_LABEL_BY_POST_DATE cannot be combined with other rollups.
  • [WCO-106219] - Number of work units in request ({actual}) exceeds allowed limit ({maximum}).
  • [WCO-106220] - You do not have access rights to the Work Unit hyperfind.
  • [WCO-106221] - An error occurred while resolving the Work Unit hyperfind. Try again.
  • [WCO-106222] - Either you do not have access rights to work units in the request, or work units are invalid.
  • [WCO-106223] - Work Unit IDs or Hyperfind is required.
  • [WCO-106224] - The combination of the columns is not valid. Each column can belong to only one entity with the exception of VOLUME_WORKUNIT which can be combined with DAILY_PRODUCTIVITY or PAYPERIOD_PRODUCTIVITY.
  • [WCO-106225] - The value of the time increment is not valid for the date range or symbolic period.
  • [WCO-106226] - Some columns are not valid for the date range or symbolic period.
  • [WCO-106227] - The combination of the column and rollup is not valid.
  • [WCO-106228] - You do not have access rights to the HCA Service.
  • [WCO-106229] - The requested data exceeds the defined limits. Shorten the date range, reduce the number of columns, change the hyperfind or Work Unit IDs.
  • [WCO-106230] - The given time increment is not valid for some of the columns.Valid {timeIncrement} value: DAY

post.description:
This operation returns one or more generic locations based on search criteria. If no search criteria is specified, all generic locations as of today are returned.

Search criteria can include the `multiReadOptions` or `where` properties with locations.

The `multiReadOptions` property can contain `modifiedSince`. The `where` property can contain locations with either ids, qualifiers, persistentIds, or externalIds. You can specify either `forDate` or `startDate` and `endDate` in the `where` property.

The associated Access Control Point is ORG_AND_JOB_BEANS.

requestBody.description: The Retrieve Generic Locations request payload.

207.description: Partial Success in retrieving generic locations.

400.description:
Bad request:

  • [WCO-103626] - Invalid location type. Only one of the following attributes can be present: id, qualifier, reference.
  • [WCO-103621] - The where condition is invalid. Only one of the following attributes can be specified: id, externalId, persistentId, qualifier, reference.
  • [WCO-103620] - The where condition is invalid. The endDate {endDate} must not be earlier than the startDate {startDate}.
  • [WCO-103619] - Invalid where condition. One or more of the following required attributes is missing: startDate: {startDate}, endDate: {endDate}.
  • [WCO-103618] - Invalid where condition. You can specify only one of these: forDate, startDate/endDate pair.
  • [WCO-103015] - The organizational object reference is mandatory and cannot be missing or empty.
  • [WCO-103617] - Invalid location reference. One of the following attributes must be present: id, persistentId, externalId, qualifier.
  • [WCO-103616] - Invalid location type. One of the following attributes must be present: id, qualifier, reference.

ExchangeCurrencyParam.description: DTO that contains parameters for converting amount from one currency to another.

amount.description: The amount to convert from one currency to another.

applyDate.description: The date for which an exchange rate is required in ISO_LOCAL_DATE format (YYYY-MM-DD).

BaseCurrency.description: The DTO for a currency policy data request.

count.description: [Optional] Requires a value greater than zero. This sets the count of data (rows) per page. For example: If you have 103 rows of data with a count of 10, each page returns 10 rows of data with 3 rows on the last page. This property has no upper limit.

groupBy.description: [Optional] Defines a list of columns for grouping the data elements in the request by means of a list of keys. Each "key" is a unique ID of the data element as defined in the Data Dictionary.Note - This field is currently not applicable to Work Unit Views.

index.description: [Optional] An index acts as the page number of the resulting set. For example: 103/10 (103 is the rows of data and 10 is the count) is partitioned into 11 pages. In this example, the index is a value between 0-10.

select.description: [Required] A list of data elements for which data is retrieved. Each data element configuration consists of a "key", which is a unique ID of the data element as defined in the Data Dictionary.

sortBy.description:
[Optional] Contains keys that define sorting behavior for each data element in the request, consisting of the following:
  • "key": [Required] a unique ID of the data element as defined in the Data Dictionary.
  • "sortDirection": [Optional] "ASC" or "DESC". Default is "DESC".

where.description:
The where criteria of the request, which are keys that define a list of elements and apply filters to each element, consisting of the following:

  • "key": [Required] A unique ID of the data element as defined in the Data Dictionary.
  • "operator": [Required] Valid values include:
    • For numeric type elements: EQUAL_TO, NOT_EQUAL_TO, GREATER_THAN, LESS_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO, IS_NULL, IS_NOT_NULL, BETWEEN, NOT_BETWEEN.
    • For Boolean type elements: ALL, YES, NO.
    • For string type elements: STARTS_WITH, NOT_STARTS, LIKE, NOT_LIKE, IN, NOT_IN, EQUAL_TO, NOT_EQUAL_TO, IS_NULL, IS_NOT_NULL, BETWEEN, NOT_BETWEEN, EXPRESSION*.
      • Note: The EXPRESSION operator is only valid for the following entities:
        • Employee Skills Display Names
        • Skill Display Name
        • Employee Skills
        • Skills Details
        • Skill Name
        • Employee Certifications Display Names
        • Certification Display Name
        • Employee Certifications
        • Certifications Details
        • Certification Name
  • "values" or "rawValues": [Required] A list of values (number, string, or Boolean) to compare:
    • For operators "BETWEEN", "NOT_BETWEEN": takes two values.
    • For operators "IN", "NOT_IN": takes any number of values.
    • For operators "ALL", "YES", "NO": takes no values.
    • For all other operators: takes one value.

metadata.description:
Response metadata, consisting of the following:

  • "totalNodes": The maximum number of nodes that can be returned.
  • "numNodes": The number of nodes returned after paging.
  • "totalElements": The number of nodes returned.
  • "lastRefreshed": The time stamp of the most recent data refresh.
  • "cacheKey": The unique identifier associated with the original request which allows for caching and paging.
  • "notCached": A Boolean indicator of whether or not the response was retrieved from the cache.
  • "metadataKey": The metadata key used to retrieve the Map of Provider Metadata used for a provider's calls.
  • "currentAsOfDateStatus": The last updated status of the most recent payroll or volume batch run. Possible status values include Consistent and Inconsistent. This property is applicable to Work Unit Views only.
  • "currentAsOfDate": The time stamp of the most recent payroll or volume batch run in ISO_LOCAL_DATE format (YYYY-MM-DD). This property is applicable to Work Unit Views only.

DataElementDefinition.description: A data element is an column of data from the Data Dictionary. The data is provided by data providers.

active.description: A Boolean indicator of whether or not the data element is active.

categories.description: The classification under which a data element falls.

cellLevelActions.description: The Cell Level Actions associated with a data element.

dataProvider.description: A key that identifies the Information Access provider which retrieves data for a data element.

deprecated.description: A Boolean indicator of whether or not the data element is deprecated.

key.description: A unique key associating a data element with its entry in the Data Dictionary.

label.description: A friendly name (description) of a data element.

properties.description: The key or value properties of a data element.

key.description: Each data element key represents an existing data element in the Data Dictionary.

sdmKey.description: The Setup Data Manager (SDM) key associated with a data element in the Data Dictionary.

value.description: The value associated with a data element key, which represents an existing data element in the Data Dictionary.

Metadata.description: Metadata that describes a data element. Metadata would include dataType, views (Data Sources), sortPolicies, roundingPolicies, formattingPolicies, categories, licenses, dataProviders and entityDefinitions

categories.description: The category of a data element - EMPLOYEE_SUMMARY, TIMEKEEPING, SCHEDULING, ATTENDANCE, KPI, LEAVE, GROUP_EDIT_RESULT, AUDIT, LOCATION and MOCK_DATA.

dataProviders.description: The domain from which a set of data originates. The following are supported domain values - TK, SCH, ATTENDANCE, PEOPLE, KPI, LEAVE, LOCATION, MOCK_ORG, GROUP_EDIT_RESULT, AUDIT, MOCK_DATA and CORE_ENTITY.

dataTypes.description: A list of supported data types. They are STRING, DATE, DATETIME, TIME, LONG, BOOLEAN, NUMBER ad ENUM.

empTSEntityDefinitions.description: A list of references to employee TS entity definitions.

entityDefinitions.description: The entity definition for a data element.

formattingPolicies.description: A set of policies for applying formats to a set of data. Supported formatting policies are - DEFAULT, CURRENCY, PERCENTAGE, TIMEDURATION, DAYDURATION, LONGDATE, BALANCE_AMOUNT. For NUMBER and LONG data type the supported policies are - DEFAULT, CURRENCY, PERCENTAGE, TIMEDURATION, DAYDURATION. For DATE the supported policies are DEFAULT, LONGDATE, SHORTDATE and DAYMONTH.

licenses.description: The license types for a data element. Currently, only DEFAULT is supported. Other licenses will be supported in future releases.

orgEntityDefinitions.description: The Organization Entity definition for a data element.

orgTSEntityDefinitions.description: A list of references to organization TS entity definitions.

providerDataUnits.description: The Provider Data Unit for a data element - HOURS or MILLISECONDS.

roundingPolicies.description: The supported rounding policies. Only applicable for NUMBER data type. Supported rounding policies are - ROUND_HALF_EVEN (6), ROUND_UP (0), ROUND_DOWN (1), ROUND_CEILING (2), ROUND_FLOOR (3), ROUND_HALF_UP (5) and ROUND_UNNECESSARY (7). If none specified ROUND_HALF_EVEN is applied by default.

sortPolicies.description: A sorting policies that can be applied for a data element. The supported policies are DEFAULT, STRING_SORT and NUMBER_SORT. User shall select NUMER_SORT for NUMBER and LONG data type. STRING_SORT for BOOLEAN, STRING data type and leave it to default if not sure.

views.description: The view in which data is rendered. Supported views are EMPLOYEE, ORGANIZATION, EMPLOYEE TIMESERIES, or ORGANIZATION TIMESERIES, enumerated as 0-EMP , 1-ORG , 2-EMP_TIME_SERIES and 3-ORGANIZATION_TIME_SERIES.

workunitEntityDefinitions.description: A list of work unit entity definitions.

workunitTSEntityDefinitions.description: A list of work unit TS entity definitions.

TimeIncrementMetaData.description: The Time Increment metadata. Contains the time increment and a list of time increment formatters.

For NUMBER and LONG data type the supported policies are - DEFAULT, CURRENCY, PERCENTAGE, TIMEDURATION, DAYDURATION. For DATE the supported policies are DEFAULT, LONGDATE, SHORTDATE and DAYMONTH.

round.description: The rounding policy of a data element. Supported rounding policies are - ROUND_HALF_EVEN (6), ROUND_UP (0), ROUND_DOWN (1), ROUND_CEILING (2), ROUND_FLOOR (3), ROUND_HALF_UP (5) and ROUND_UNNECESSARY (7). If none specified ROUND_HALF_EVEN is applied by default.

scale.description: The scale to apply to a data element. Only applicable for the NUMBER data type.

sort.description: The sorting policy of a data element. Possible values includes: DEFAULT, STRING_SORT, NUMBER_SORT
